intro: Neillia glandulocalyx, commonly known as the glandular-calyx neillia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine, glandular hairs. Neillia glandulocalyx is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
